item.title: How Your Sandwich Changed The World
item.description: June 20, 2017 - What road did your lunch travel before it reached your plate? NPR's latest animated video follows a BLT from the fields where it began its journey.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - What road did your lunch travel before it reached your plate? NPR's latest animated video follows a BLT from the fields where it began its journey. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/20/533128467/how-your-sandwich-changed-the-world

item.title: Hidden Brain: Terror Strikes And An Attacker's Identity
item.description: June 20, 2017 - Research shows people are more likely to label an attack as terrorism if the perpetrator is Muslim. Terrorist attacks committed by Muslims receive more coverage than those not committed by Muslims.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - Research shows people are more likely to label an attack as terrorism if the perpetrator is Muslim. Terrorist attacks committed by Muslims receive more coverage than those not committed by Muslims. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533619763/hidden-brain-terror-attacks

item.title: Study Finds Yoga Can Help Back Pain, But Keep It Gentle, With These Poses
item.description: June 20, 2017 - A yoga class designed specifically for lower back pain can be as effective as physical therapy in easing pain, the study says. The class and teacher manuals are available online, for free.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - A yoga class designed specifically for lower back pain can be as effective as physical therapy in easing pain, the study says. The class and teacher manuals are available online, for free. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/20/533505211/study-finds-yoga-can-help-back-pain-but-keep-it-gentle-with-these-poses

item.title: When Is It 'Terrorism'? How The Media Cover Attacks By Muslim Perpetrators
item.description: June 19, 2017 - In the last five years, 12 percent of terrorist attacks in the U.S. were carried out by Muslims and more than 50 percent by far right extremists. So why the media focus on "Islamic terrorism"?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - In the last five years, 12 percent of terrorist attacks in the U.S. were carried out by Muslims and more than 50 percent by far right extremists. So why the media focus on "Islamic terrorism"? http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/532963059/when-is-it-terrorism-how-the-media-covers-attacks-by-muslim-perpetrators

item.title: Ethiopia's Coffee Farmers Are 'On The Front Lines Of Climate Change'
item.description: June 19, 2017 - A new study says that Ethiopia could lose more than 50 percent of its coffee growing regions to climate change. But, higher altitude areas could become more suitable for coffee in the coming decades.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - A new study says that Ethiopia could lose more than 50 percent of its coffee growing regions to climate change. But, higher altitude areas could become more suitable for coffee in the coming decades. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/19/533538555/ethiopias-coffee-farmers-are-on-the-front-lines-of-climate-change

item.title: A Couple's Quest To Stop A Rare Disease Before It Takes One Of Them
item.description: June 19, 2017 - Twenty years. That's how long two grad students, Sonia Vallabh and Eric Minikel, think they have before a deadly disease envelops Sonia's brain. The Massachusetts couple is now racing to find a cure.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - Twenty years. That's how long two grad students, Sonia Vallabh and Eric Minikel, think they have before a deadly disease envelops Sonia's brain. The Massachusetts couple is now racing to find a cure. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/19/527795512/a-couples-quest-to-stop-a-rare-disease-before-it-takes-one-of-them

item.title: Can You Find The Defibrillator At Work? Half Of People Say No
item.description: June 19, 2017 - People who work in the hospitality and service industries were even less likely to know where to find an AED, according to a new survey. The devices can restart someone's heart after cardiac arrest.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - People who work in the hospitality and service industries were even less likely to know where to find an AED, according to a new survey. The devices can restart someone's heart after cardiac arrest. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/19/533269211/can-you-find-the-defibrillator-at-work-half-of-people-say-no

item.title: Over Objections, Italy Introduces Tough Vaccination Measure
item.description: June 19, 2017 - In Italy, parents who don't vaccinate their children face steep fines, and even risk losing custody. It's in response to a measles outbreak, after years of falling inoculation rates.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - In Italy, parents who don't vaccinate their children face steep fines, and even risk losing custody. It's in response to a measles outbreak, after years of falling inoculation rates. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533481635/over-objections-italy-introduces-tough-vaccination-measure

item.title: A Mother's Early Death Drives Her Daughter To Find A Treatment
item.description: June 19, 2017 - Sonia Vallabh knows that by the time she's middle-aged, a rare inherited disease will likely start killing off her brain cells. She and her husband have become scientists to try to stop the disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 19, 2017 - Sonia Vallabh knows that by the time she's middle-aged, a rare inherited disease will likely start killing off her brain cells. She and her husband have become scientists to try to stop the disease. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/19/533220784/a-mothers-early-death-drives-her-daughter-to-find-a-treatment

item.title: Research Finds Dressmakers Have Good Eyes, And Not Just For Style
item.description: June 16, 2017 - In a study of people from a variety of professions, dressmakers were found to have superior 3-D vision. Could their endless hours of delicate handwork be honing eyesight?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - In a study of people from a variety of professions, dressmakers were found to have superior 3-D vision. Could their endless hours of delicate handwork be honing eyesight? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/16/532936445/research-finds-dressmakers-have-good-eyes-and-not-just-for-style

item.title: Doctor Who Wrote 1980 Letter On Painkillers Regrets That It Fed The Opioid Crisis
item.description: June 16, 2017 - In 1980, Dr. Hershel Jick wrote a one-paragraph letter about low rates of addiction among hospitalized patients given narcotics. It was later cited as evidence that long-term opioid use was safe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 16, 2017 - In 1980, Dr. Hershel Jick wrote a one-paragraph letter about low rates of addiction among hospitalized patients given narcotics. It was later cited as evidence that long-term opioid use was safe. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/16/533060031/doctor-who-wrote-1980-letter-on-painkillers-regrets-that-it-fed-the-opioid-crisi

item.title: Explorers Probing Deep Sea Abyss Off Australia's Coast Find Living Wonders
item.description: June 15, 2017 - A monthlong expedition into one of the deepest, least-documented places on the planet discovered hundreds of unknown species. The finds included a "faceless fish" undocumented there since 1873.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - A monthlong expedition into one of the deepest, least-documented places on the planet discovered hundreds of unknown species. The finds included a "faceless fish" undocumented there since 1873. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/15/533063615/explorers-probing-deep-sea-abyss-off-australias-coast-find-living-wonders

item.title: Lead Detected In Baby Food Samples. Pediatricians Say There's No Safe Level
item.description: June 15, 2017 - Twenty percent of baby food samples were found to contain lead, according to a report from the Environmental Defense Fund. Pediatricians say there's no safe lead level. FDA is reviewing its policy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - Twenty percent of baby food samples were found to contain lead, according to a report from the Environmental Defense Fund. Pediatricians say there's no safe lead level. FDA is reviewing its policy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/15/533103892/lead-detected-in-baby-food-samples-pediatricians-say-theres-no-safe-level

item.title: Inside Mars Simulator, IKEA Designers Learn How To Live In Close Quarters
item.description: June 15, 2017 - IKEA exiled designers to a research station in Utah modeled after a living situation on the planet Mars. They hope the experience will inspire them to create similar spaces around the world.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - IKEA exiled designers to a research station in Utah modeled after a living situation on the planet Mars. They hope the experience will inspire them to create similar spaces around the world. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/15/533102606/inside-mars-simulator-ikea-designers-learn-how-to-live-in-close-quarters

item.title: The Roots Of Consciousness: We're Of 2 Minds
item.description: June 15, 2017 - Surgery that severs the link between brain hemispheres reveals that those halves have way different views of the world. We ask a pioneering scientist what that tells us about human consciousness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 2017 - Surgery that severs the link between brain hemispheres reveals that those halves have way different views of the world. We ask a pioneering scientist what that tells us about human consciousness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/15/532920899/the-roots-of-consciousness-were-of-two-minds
